news.headline: Thermo Fisher lifts profit forecast as medical equipment demand improves
news.summary: The medical equipment maker in January signaled that muted demand for its services used in the making of therapies and vaccines will extend at least into the first half of the year, but could pick up later.  The Waltham, Massachusetts-based firm said it now expects annual adjusted profit of $21.14 to $22.02 per share, compared with its previous forecast of $20.95 to $22 per share.  Analysts had estimated a profit of $21.53 per share for 2024, according to LSEG data.

news.headline: Thermo Fisher Lifts Annual Forecast On Improved Demand, Despite Q1 Revenue Dip
news.summary: On Wednesday, Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc. (NYSE: TMO) posted a first-quarter revenue of $10.34 billion, down 3% year over year, beating the consensus of $10.17 billion. Organic revenue was 4% lower, and core organic revenue growth declined by 3%. Revenue from the Life Sciences Solutions Segment declined by 12.5% to $2.29 billion. Analytical Instruments Segment sales were down 2.1% to $1.69 billion. Specialty Diagnostics Segment revenues were almost flat at $1.1 billion, and Laboratory Products
